readme_content:
- 👋 Hi, I’m Fernando Herrera @Klerith
- 👀 I’m interested in Coding, Teaching, Video Games, Legos!
- 🌱 I’m currently learning a lot of stuff

<!---
Klerith/Klerith is a ✨ special ✨ repository because its `README.md` (this file) appears on your GitHub profile.
You can click the Preview link to take a look at your changes.
--->

[![Anurag's GitHub stats](https://github-readme-stats.vercel.app/api?username=klerith&theme=transparent)](https://github.com/anuraghazra/github-readme-stats)

Klerith/react-hooks.summary: Recent activities involved a series of updates to upgrade React and React-DOM to version 19.0.0, including adjusting package resolutions in yarn.lock and updating package.json. Multiple push events were made on December 12, 2024, to reflect these changes and ensure compatibility with the new version.

DevTalles-corp/angular-gif-app.summary: The repository has seen significant updates, particularly around the integration of the Giphy API for trending GIFs and search functionality. This includes implementing a Giphy service, adding a GIF search history feature, and enhancing the service to load search history from local storage. Additionally, the README.md file was updated to reflect project setup instructions in Spanish.

DevTalles-corp/angular-pipes-app.summary: Recent activities include the addition of an uncommon page and card component, along with the implementation of i18n pipes for dynamic client management. New pipes were also added to the uncommon page, including SlicePipe, JsonPipe, KeyValuePipe, and AsyncPipe, to enhance functionality.

DevTalles-corp/expo-movies-app.summary: A recent update involved updating ReactNative to version 52+, indicating efforts to keep the project compatible with the latest frameworks and technologies.

profile_summary: I'm Fernando Herrera, a seasoned developer with expertise in TypeScript, C++, and JavaScript, actively contributing to the coding community through my 528 public repositories. With a strong network of over 13,000 followers, I'm passionate about coding, teaching, and continuously learning new technologies. As a versatile developer with a wide range of interests, I enjoy exploring new projects and sharing my knowledge with others.
